bibl.title: Letter from John Dalzell to Mabel H. Lazear, December 9, 1907

div1.p: Dalzell will support an increase in Mabel Lazear's pension.

div1.head: Letter from John Dalzell to Mabel H. Lazear, December 9, 1907
div1.opener:
LAZEAR AND ORR
ATTORNEYS AT LAW
480 FOURTH AVENUE
PITTSBURGH, PA.
THOS C. LAZEAR CHAS F. ORR
JESSE W. LAZEAR
( C O P Y )
COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS,
House of Representatives,
Washington, D. C.
December 9th, 1907.
Thomas C. Lazear, Esq.,
Pittsburg, Pa.
My Dear Mr. Lazear:-
div1.p:
I shall be very glad to render any assistance
that I can towards the passage of legislation for the relief of
Mrs. Mabel H. Lazear, widow of your nephew, who sacrificed his
life in Cuba in connection with the investigation made by the
Yellow Fever Commission. I regard her cause as an exceedingly
worthy one. I am only fearful that it will be difficult to se-
cure the desired legislation because of one of the rules governing
the action of the Pension Committee which reads “Where original
pension or increase of pension has been allowed by special Act,
no proposition for additional pension will be entertained.”
Whether it shall be possible to secure any modification of this
rule, I am unable to say. I am prepared, however, to do the
best I can towards making Mrs. Lazear's case a special one.
